name: Water Melon
description:
DVD of the Colin Bateman scripted movie based on Marian Keyes' best selling novel, starring Anna Friel and Brenda Fricker.   This was originally shown on ITV in 2003 and later distributed by the Daily Mail as part of its Romance Collection.  
*UK postage is free, please enquire about overseas.

name: Cycle of Violence
description:
Extremely rare hardback copy of Colin's second novel which was later filmed as 'Crossmaheart' and then much later released as 'Dead Man's Girl' in America.  This is the US edition of the book.  It was never released in hardback in the UK.  
* UK postage is free, please enquire about RoI and overseas

name: Empire State
description:
very rare hard-backed copy of Empire State, signed by the author.  

Wild American adventure of two Irish exiles, culminating in the accidental kidnapping of the US President on top of the Empire State Building.

It’s bad enough having a name like Nathan Jones – unless you’re a Supremes fan, which Nathan isn’t – but when his girlfriend leaves him (for a drag queen) and he gets mugged, then handcuffed to a bed and cut up in a misunderstanding with an S&M hooker, it looks as if things can’t get any worse for this exile in the Big Apple. But they can! Will Nathan get his girl back? Will the President survive imprisonment by a psychotic white supremist in (rapidly melting) black-face? Will veteran lift-operator Sam McClusky get his job back? Find out in Empire State.

The stage is set for a vintage Bateman adventure, which takes the world of politics – international, racial and sexual – and holds it hostage atop the most famous building on Earth.   *UK postage is free, enquire about ROI and overseas.

name: Mohammed Maguire
description:
Very rare hard-backed copy of this neglected classic, if the author does say so himself!   Signed.    
* UK postage is free, please enquire about ROI and overseas.

name: Running with the Reservoir Pups
description:
‘Running with the Reservoir Pups’ is the story of twelve year old Eddie Malone, a boy who has a bad habit of being in the wrong place at the wrong time.   Now he’s gotten mixed up with the Reservoir Pups, the scrappy gang of boys who rule the streets in his new town. And why on earth has he agreed to break into the hospital his mum works at? It’s just Eddie’s luck that he quickly stumbles upon a kidnapping plan that implicates Scuttles, the hospital’s head of security – and his mum’s new boyfriend. 
‘Running with the Reservoir Pups’ was acclaimed on its first publication in 2003.   

‘This author’s hilarious, dark Northern Irish wit, penchant for action-packed mayhem, sense of irony and snappy dialogue are all evident in this outrageously comic caper,’ said the (US) School Library Journal. 

‘A zany caper…innovative, far-fetched tale makes for great entertainment,’  said (US) Publishers Weekly.  * UK postage is free, please enquire about ROI and overseas.
